Body: Possible Duplicate:  I've rooted my phone. Now what?  Are there any risks to rooting a device?  Given that the new T-Mobile G2 based on Android 2.2 (and so called 4G network) attempts to address much of the reasons people rooted previous phones, is there any benefit to still find a way to root this phone?Other than potentially voiding warranty, what are the legal implications (e.g., DCMA ban on technical workarounds)?
Title: Is there any benefit to rooting the new T-Mobile G2, and what are the legal issues?

history.Text: Given that the new T-Mobile G2 based on Android 2.2 (and so called 4G network) attempts to address much of the reasons people rooted previous phones, is there any benefit to still find a way to root this phone?Also, has a permanent root method been found? Finally, other than potentially voiding warranty, what are the legal implications (e.g., DCMA ban on technical workarounds)?ps: could someone with more reputation than me create a tag "Legal", and tag this question accordingly. thanks.
Is there any benefit to rooting the new T-Mobile G2, and what are the legal issues?

history.Comment: yes, there is a permanent root method.
